website_summaries.verdict: You may like this plant cover if you don't need serious or long-term protection, but it doesn't live up to the durability claims of some competitors in its class.
pros: Protects small, delicate seedlings without weighing them down
cons: Prone to ripping with typical use
Not likely to stay in place in windy conditions
May not last more than one season

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fabric last year and it was great. This year I ordered more for a second bed and the quality is terrible! It's half the thickness of last year's fabric, almost transparent, and flimsy. The right (long) edge is not finished and is fraying. I have an email out to the seller to see what's going on, will update this review accordingly. Update: Heard back from USA Commerce, they say the product is the same quality as what I bought last year. I completely disagree, I had both of them open in my garden yesterday and there is an obvious difference between the two. I'm returning it, will find another solution.
customer_reviews.author: Deb T

customer_reviews.title: Frost cover
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much- based on the price but I was wrong! My garden has survived the first cold snap - where temperatures dropped into the high 20's! I have used other products previously but this one allows sunshine and rain through therefore acting as a frost barrier only. Brilliant! Will definitely buy when needed again; it seems sturdy enough to take off and on as the weather demands and will likely last more than one season. I do recommend rocks or bricks to hold the fabric down, if you clip or pin it it may tear and not last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! My plants look great! The critters don't eat my plants, the rain gets through and sun is let in but it is filtered sun so the plants don't "bake!" I stand by this product 100%!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The item I received from USA-Commerce isn't genuine Agribon
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Agribon AG-19 Row Cover from USA-Commerce, but what I received is a counterfeit. If it was a good quality fake, I would be able to use it, but this material has low light transmission - it wouldn't let enough sunlight through for my vegetables. Also, it sheds water.
customer_reviews.author: Adu

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy but based on timing and needing to move on ...
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as 83” x 50’. I unrolled it and measured it because I needed exactly 2 pieces at 25’ each. This order was short. It was 12” short in length and 6” short in width. So from 83” x 50’ I received 77” x 49’. With the shortage, now I cannot cover what I intended to do. I am not happy but based on timing and needing to move on with my project I’ll have to figure out a work around. I have bought agribon for a few years but never from this supplier and will not again. No excuses for being cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: This is not Agribon brand row covering. It’s a cheap fake.
customer_reviews.text: The item I received was not “Agribon” 19. It’s some kind of generic unmarked plain white unknown fabric that came in a plain unmarked plastic bag. It is not Legitimate Agribon Brand row covering. It’s a cheap fake. I’m outraged. I’m sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: We've had temps down to the teens in the past week, and my broccoli, collard greens, brussels sprouts, and lettuce plants still look good. So far, I've used a single layer for light frosts and a double layer for hard freezes. It's thin and lets light through, so I didn't take it off when we were having consecutive freezing nights. Since it's thin, I already have a few small tears where it's caught on the cinder blocks in my raised garden. I'm learning to be more careful. No freezes are predicted for the week ahead, so I've put it away for now. It provides a lot of coverage for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Agribon? Probably not
customer_reviews.text: Product came in a plain, unmarked plastic bag. Material is very lightweight compared to previous Agribon covers I have bought, with no imprinting of Agribon name on fabric. Looks like a knock off being advertised as the real Agribon brand. Read other reviewers saying same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Applescruffs

customer_reviews.title: Too thin to attach to your frames.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed.....This is very thin, I purchased the pvc clips to secure this product over my pvc hoops.....it would tear as I tried to attach the clip. I tried giving extra fabric to not stretch it, but even on the end it would tear when attaching it....One section that did get put up without holes only lasted a weekend .... and this was in a protected area without much wind. I ended up laying it on the ground with the poles on it just to keep weeds at bay.
customer_reviews.author: Shell 1972

customer_reviews.title: Meh.  Fine to block sun, not much frost protection.
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty thin. I used it in spring because we had a cold snap and I planted a little early hoping to get lucky. I used 1/2 inch PVC and created a tent over my raised bed garden. Temperature dropped to the high 20’s overnight for one night. My tomato plants and pepper plants died immediately in my that night. The cold weather vegetables were fine. I didn’t expect miracles but I don’t think this fabric provided much protection against frost. My father, who lives nearby and experienced the same weather, used a plastic cover over each plant and his tomatoes survived. Next time I plant early, I’ll go with that option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and killed plants
customer_reviews.text: I used this for just a couple of cold evenings that went below freezing. All the parts that were touching the plants got “burned” and the temp never exceeded 60 degrees Fahrenheit. It also killed 4 plants completely. I threw it away, such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for a couple years. My seedlings grow better, and it offers good protection from light frost. Good for keeping out cabbage moths and such, but even one or two nights without a cover will result in caterpillars. Yes, it will tear a bit in a strong wind when I hold it down with bricks with sharp edges. No problem if I use boards, and put a brick on top of each board (if windy). What works best for me is to staple one end to a 1x3 inch board, so I can roll it up to store over the winter. That also holds one end down, making it easier to spread out in a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: BobJ

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for our trees.
customer_reviews.text: This product was a lifesaver, protecting new trees from the cicadas. Not your traditional use but a godsend.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Preuhs

customer_reviews.title: Just as described.
customer_reviews.text: I used this when I went away for six days. I covered my garden with it. Apparently there were a few army worms inside so some plants leaves were still eaten, but I think less than if the garden was completely exposed. The grasshoppers would have had a field day. I can't speak on how permeable it is. We had some rain while we were away. When I returned, pouring water on it just made it cave in and I wasn't interested in waiting around to see if it would penetrate and/or how long it would take. Sorry I didn't take a picture. I wish I did.
customer_reviews.author: D Knight

customer_reviews.title: Did great at protecting vegetable garden during storms.
customer_reviews.text: This is our first season growing vegetables. We have three 4'x8' raised garden beds along with a 12'x6' section planted on the ground. I set up PVC pipe arches over all my beds and clamped the fabric to them before storms. They did a great job during storms that included torrential downpours, high winds and hail. None of them had any damage or tears. My plants remained safe and healthy. I'm sure I will be able to reuse them for the next growing season and possibly more seasons after that.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The sides aren't finished and stick to everything. Bought the same type of row cover from Agfabric and it's much better. I'll never buy from Agribon again. Too late to return because Amazon doesn't stand behind what they sell!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Vawser

customer_reviews.title: A Garden Must Have for Veg Growers!
customer_reviews.text: This cloth is now a gardening requirement! It weathered 3 thunderstorms and kept early veg from drowning, prevented scald on tomatoes when TN weird heat came early, and stayed covered (propped on twigs & positioned with small clay pots) despite Nashville spring “derecho” winds that knocked out city power, old growth trees. My teen sons loved not having to cover/uncover tender veg as Mother Nature has been confused all spring.
customer_reviews.author: ellestar27

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used these before and bought for purpose of hiding my strawberry plants for dang deer. Worked perfectly AND to my amazement when I lifted it to check on my plants this week it was notably warmer inside and my poor little plants chewed off by deer had done not only a total recovery but were HUGE and already had flowers all over them way ahead of schedule. Ordering more for my pepper and tomato plants so I can plant earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Cilenia

customer_reviews.title: Not the real deal
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a plain plastic bag, no Agribon labeling at all in the packaging OR the fabric. It looks like the edges were cut by a kindergartener. USA-Commerce is selling counterfeit Agribon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps plants protected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover my plants in the early months of the year to avoid frost damage and to keep them warm. The netting works great, and I have no complaints about it. It is very thin, so you need to be careful not to rip it. It’s also sewable. I messed up the size on a piece and was able to stitch two pieces back together with no adverse effects.
customer_reviews.author: Fulgrim

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for gardeners
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my seedlings from several light frosts, and also seems to help with pests to a degree. The only problem with it so far is that earwigs LOVE to hide in the folds if I don't lay it completely flat. Overall, I am so happy to have this as a novice gardener. I feel much more confident putting my seedlings out early, which will hopefully result in a larger yield this year. Even though I live in an area with a long growing season, it never hurts to get a head start. Plus it's a great value--SO much material for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra.I

customer_reviews.title: Frays easily
customer_reviews.text: Works well but frays easily and wind is tearing it apart. Not good long term solution. Used to cover fig tree to keep birds out and so far has been doing the job, though will barley last through the season.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Sirakides

customer_reviews.title: It is just a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 weeks on the hoop house, the cover tore and created three big holes from the wind. We needed to use duct-tape to seal so that the hole doesn't get bigger. Everyone needs to use bricks to secure the row cover on the ground so that it doesn't fly away with the wind. This row cover gets torn at the spots where bricks were placed!! This is totally unacceptable quality. It is just a waste of money, get a thicker and better brand.
customer_reviews.author: YYM

customer_reviews.title: It would be great to use to wrap fruit trees & bushes during ...
customer_reviews.text: This product kept my veggies & herbs from freezing in December & January during 6+ weeks of very cold temps in South Carolina. Also, it kept potted flowers and ferns OK on the patio and front porch. It would be great to use to wrap fruit trees & bushes during those early Feb & Mar cold snaps.
customer_reviews.author: CCRose

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to cut to size
customer_reviews.text: This is more durable than I expected. I have covered all the seeds in the garden to keep the birds out. It's easy to cut to size. It is an excellent weight and rain and sun penetrate. Maintains heat very well. After nearly two weeks I am very happy with the growth of my plants and the protection provided. The only reason I didn't give it a five is I would have like it to be about 1-2 feet wider for the size of our beds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packages. They worked so well to protect my garden from frost that I bought three more floating row covers. They are a perfect size for my garden beds, and cover each of my 4' x 25' beds generously. I can remove them during the day when the sun comes out and they are perfectly protected. Looking forward to using them again beginning this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: raintree

customer_reviews.title: Saved my veggie garden during a freak late snowstorm.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is lightweight, it provided enough insulation to get my plants through some seriously wacky weather. When I pulled the fabric up after the storm, a bunch of new plants had even come up!
customer_reviews.author: Carie

customer_reviews.title: Saved my garden
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, saved my plants after I planted them too early in the season. Not as breathable as I anticipated, it promoted growth of fungus before I took it off for the season, but definitely worth the purchase. I also use it under a baby pool to prevent mulch from going into the pool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well and does not tear easily
customer_reviews.text: Mine came without the Agribon logo but quality appears to be comparable. Has stood up well to weather and abuse and so far shows no sign of damage even from falling branches. Will see if we can get a few seasons out of them but so far the fall plants seem content.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCall

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the early frost of the season and it appeared to protect a large section of what it covered. Some things like eggplants died either way. It was a bit difficult rolling this up with all the ice set in and caused quite the mess. Nevertheless, I look forward to using these and will likely even buy a couple more rolls this season.
customer_reviews.author: mosa

customer_reviews.title: I am using this to cover my zucchini plants until ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to cover my zucchini plants until they bloom trying to keep the squash moth off of the stem of my plants. It is strong enough to last a few seasons when treated with care. Water does not penetrate the cover, though, so I loosen it up around the ends and water the plants. It would be easier to use if and when I could afford to buy some hoops or some fencing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dryman

customer_reviews.title: Successfully Using on a Cold Frame
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this material (doubled up) as a cover for a cold frame, and it is working beautifully. It seems to be holding up very well, too, although this is my first season I've used it, having stapled it on my cold frame only a couple months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Wallerish

customer_reviews.title: Water does not go through this!
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure I received a knock off. There is no way water is going through this. It’s just pools on top and then crushes your tender vegetation. Plan on having to remove it every time you need to water! Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: M. D.

customer_reviews.title: A great product and reusable
customer_reviews.text: Agribon saved my garden this spring! I used it during an excessively rainy time and it allowed water through, but kept the area from becoming flooded out. I also used it when I just planted my sunflowers. It prevented the birds from eating the seeds before germination. A great product and reusable.
customer_reviews.author: Daffodil

customer_reviews.title: It works good, I was impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had never used row cover before. It works good, I was impressed.. Use it to keep frost off of plants that are already somewhat cold hardy. It gave plants extra time to produce before the really cold days even the greenbeans. I am looking forward to spring to get a head start on early planting and to keep the flying insects off too.
customer_reviews.author: wellnessguru

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Used it to protect new seedlings from sun - then used for newly planted sunflower seeds to protect from rabbits until they have time to grow a bit! Meets my expectations for light and water to get through!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Our plants love it
customer_reviews.text: We put this over a couple beds of mixed veggies to protect them from bugs and everything grew massively!! It kept them a bit warmer during our cool spring and helped so much. I will definitely be using this every year.
customer_reviews.author: mom of twins

customer_reviews.title: These row covers are great, and were just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These row covers are great, and were just what I was looking for. They actually made it possible for me to save some of the (many) last fruits that weren't quite ripe on my pepper plants as the weather turned cooler. I was able to keep the plants a few extra weeks in the cooler weather, and the fruit was able to ripen naturally on the plants. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: shrklover9

customer_reviews.title: Kept seedlings from frosting in late spring snow
customer_reviews.text: This cloth worked great to keep my early-planted mid-May seedlings from frosting in a late spring light snow in raised garden beds. It is so light it didn't smash the seedlings but heavy enough to keep them from freezing. I haven't used any other type of row cover to compare this to, but I know this brand worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: An_Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm using to protect strawberry plants from squirrels. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using to protect strawberry plants from squirrels. The berries aren't ripe yet so I don't know how well it will work once the berries ripen and the squirrels become interested. The plants seem to be doing well after having been covered for a couple of weeks. The fabric lets rain and enough sunlight through.
customer_reviews.author: DTF

customer_reviews.title: Great Bird Deterrent
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight enough that the sun still gets through to the plants, but the birds can't eat them. This is the second time I've ordered this product and It's pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: WASue

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I covered up my strawberries to prolong their growing season. It has snowed, and the rest of the plants have been gone for a while. The strawberry plants I covered are still green.
customer_reviews.author: elsie gooslin

customer_reviews.title: Used as said in Square Foot Gardening & Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Love using this product in my Raised 4x4 garden. I haven’t opened this package yet but my previous ordered ones were just thrown away because it had become dirty after years of use.
customer_reviews.author: SiberianHuskyFan

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, it installed easily over some fence wire I cut into 60" pieces and stuck several inches into the ground. I used long ground staples to secure the cover to the ground and it's tearing a little, but this is the lightweight cover, so I think that's to be expected. I think it will last 1 or possible 2 seasons over my fall crops.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Evens

customer_reviews.title: Keeps pest out!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the garden to keep pest away from squash vine borers. I’ve had problems for several years and this product protected the plants from pest. I have a big bounty of squash thanks to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one season
customer_reviews.text: This only lasted one summer. And by the end of the summer, the little white butterflies were getting in holes and laying lots of eggs on my broccoli and cabbage.... If the fabric touches a plant, there will be holes, so keep plants trimmed if you do not want holes. Kind of expensive for only one season.
customer_reviews.author: quizout

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great. Bought it to protect my veggies from our ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great. Bought it to protect my veggies from our extreme heat we are experiencing right now. I also put it over my dwarf apple tree to prevent the black birds from destroying all of my apples. Both applications are working great!
customer_reviews.author: BLM

customer_reviews.title: Saved spring plants frost
customer_reviews.text: Used this spring and worked well. I'm in Arizona so we have not very cold evenings but saved plants at 30°♡
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: We installed these just the other day and they did not disappoint. For the size and price this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Neal W. Vickers

customer_reviews.title: A lot of row cover
customer_reviews.text: I use these on all my garden in times of 30 or below. I use it on my hedges, raised beds, potted plants. Works great while letting the plants breath.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: long enough for my blackberry patches, but had to ...
customer_reviews.text: long enough for my blackberry patches, but had to staple two of these together to reach the ground on both sides. Definitely not wide enough. Kept the jap beetles off anyway.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zabloski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product not too heavy nor too light. Perfect to lay on plants or clothespin to trellis. Cut easily too.
customer_reviews.author: PJC

customer_reviews.title: covering the plants
customer_reviews.text: THis product was as described and I will see when we have frost if it works as predicted.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwiaz

customer_reviews.title: Am happy with this product, so far.
customer_reviews.text: It works good for my garden plants especially with over 90 degrees heat and saved my lettuces from bolting. I have not tried it on light frost yet.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it is supposed to be like that. I could only use about on half ...
customer_reviews.text: one edge was frayed and snagged on everything it came in contact with. I don't think it is supposed to be like that. I could only use about on half of it. I hope Agribon does better than that. I wanted to use the rest of it this spring, but not now.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hedgpeth

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, disintegrates on contact with soil
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It is so thin, any edges of the fabric that touch the soil just disintegrates. I was hoping to reuse the fabric for years but obviously it’s a one time use product. I will have to cut edges off to save what I can for the next year.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Versatile plant protector!
customer_reviews.text: This material is great for holding in heat and keeping critters out! Exactly as described. I use it on my vegetable garden starts and anything I plant by seed to keep the rabbits and deer from eating the tender starts. Will reuse until i need more!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Collins

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Keeps cabbage moths and aphids off of brassicas, working great. Holding up to our gusty winds by burying one side and holding down other side with old 2x4s. No holes or tears yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Silva

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The fibers separated into something like a spider web on one of my 2 agribon rolls. It's still usable, but I don't think it does as good of a job. Made super cheaply compared to older agribon I've previously used.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great weight for blocking sun and bugs from your sensitive plants and seedlings. Use some sort of stakes to keep it off them, but even then if they are strong enough it will not be too much for the plants. The price was a little high, but with Prime its OK if you need it right away. It will tear if it comes across sharp edges and you pull too hard, but it's lighter than a sheet or plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Charles In Sumter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It's what it was advertised as being,works for my heat sensitive vegies
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A. Stobel

customer_reviews.title: Passable but not very good
customer_reviews.text: This is a light weight row cover and as you can see in the picture you can see through it. Previously I purchased Agfabric floating row cover and it is a heavier fabric, this product catches and unravels the threads. It is doubtful that it will be able to be moved to another garden as the season progresses. Would not purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Seipel

customer_reviews.title: Grass growing help
customer_reviews.text: This is good crop cover, we use it to grow grass also & keep off birds & minimize dog damage to the grass growing area. Good price compared to our garden stores.
customer_reviews.author: Atieno

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great and there's a LOT of it. I got it to protect my arugula from tiny bugs.
customer_reviews.author: JCamy

customer_reviews.title: Great agricultural fabric.
customer_reviews.text: Product tears to easily but this cloth has had my winter veggies growing til mid December and that’s impressive being that there’s been snow on the ground. Worth buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Protected our garden from early frosts
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. Protected our garden plants from two early frosts and extended our growing season. Good quality. Will purchase again when needed. We use bricks to hold it down rather than put staples through the product (which can result in tearing of the material).
customer_reviews.author: Lauren K.

customer_reviews.title: Super light and perfect for a row cover. Actual dimensions were 88 inches and 49 feet.
customer_reviews.text: It probably is 50 feet stretched out tight as a drum but that's not how you use a floating row cover so that was annoying. Fortunately I made my PVC frames and garden plot after the fact and not before.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight Fabric
customer_reviews.text: This is the product I needed for my raised garden to get an early start and for protection from critters. Has worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: D. Fox

customer_reviews.title: i've used similar row covers in the past, this ...
customer_reviews.text: i've used similar row covers in the past, this one is high quality, thick enough for some frost protection, but allowing plenty of light to get through so that you can use it to protect plants from insects.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne T

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t allow the burn of the sun only the warmth and light.  Perfect for the raised garden cart I use for my tomatoes.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight fabric . Hope it will last this season. Definitely a good protection from moths that lay eggs, which turn into the infamous hook worm.
customer_reviews.author: Barb K

customer_reviews.title: Works fine!
customer_reviews.text: This is working great for us. Hasn't torn (but we're careful) and discourages the rodents (squirrels!) Fabric resembles the bottom lining you may have seen on boxspring. I'll use again next year
customer_reviews.author: E. Bergling

customer_reviews.title: A garden must have!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product is an understatement! I've posted pics of brussel sprouts with and without. The pictures speak for themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Hornaday

customer_reviews.title: Works-saved my garden
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Saved my garden from birds stealing seeds. Lightweight, sun & water pass through
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. I clipped it to the hoops over my ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. I clipped it to the hoops over my raised beds and allowed me to start my garden earlier than I normally do. I liked that it allowed water through, where the plastic I had been using did not.
customer_reviews.author: Leesa Witt Michael

customer_reviews.title: Protects Plants
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product before and it was everything I wanted it to be. Keeps plants protected and able to water through material as well as receive sunlight. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich J

customer_reviews.title: Hope it keeps out the moth which lays the eggs ...
customer_reviews.text: Hope it keeps out the moth which lays the eggs that in turn become the squash vine borers. Plenty of fabric for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderturkey

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: I placed two separate orders for this product. The first package was very flimsy and thready - very easy to tear through; probably won't last a month. The second package was more of a fabric material; much stronger and better quality. Don't know why there was such a difference in quality- one was satisfactory and the other was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: amarie

customer_reviews.title: Not real Agribon
customer_reviews.text: Not real agri-bon. Real Agribon has the word Agribon printed on it. Its very thin compared to what Im used to. The clips tore it pretty easily. Make sure you have a plan, because you wont get many re-dos. It does seem like it will work tho, and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: A very endurable product and I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I dont know how I got along without this row cover. It holds up good and does everything it suppose to do. A fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sugg

customer_reviews.title: Great Frost Covers!
customer_reviews.text: Frost Covers are wonderful! I tie them down on each end of row. Keeps my plants protected from wind and frost damage.
customer_reviews.author: darline

customer_reviews.title: Poor material.
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly. The thinnest crop cover I've ever seen. Snagged on everything and edges shredded at the slightest touch.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Geroux

customer_reviews.title: Every garden needs this!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Saved my garden this spring as I put in tomatoes and peppers during a warm spell, and then we had 10 days of very sub-normal temperatures. I recommend this product very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Zenpup

customer_reviews.title: This was too thin and didn't work well but we ...
customer_reviews.text: This was too thin and didn't work well but we had record-breaking 20 degree weather for several days in Houston. The roots of the plants did survive, however and are growing back.
customer_reviews.author: wyotx

customer_reviews.title: Frayed Edge
customer_reviews.text: This was cut from a larger size leaving a frayed edge that is constantly getting things stuck to it and seems like it will lower the lifespan of the product. It's a good product, but I would buy it from a different seller that isn't cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Durable and easy to work with. Takes a pretty good sharp rock to tear through this first season, but I expect this material to last a few more. I really didn't realize how helpful it would be towards keeping bugs and bunnies at bay.
customer_reviews.author: fivesense

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great to keep hot sun off of lettuce and keep bugs from eating plants.
customer_reviews.author: Judy K Collins

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Cut in half and stapled back together to form a large square (couldn't find a square one). Used to cover my square patch of Blackberry plants while fruiting to protect the berries from the Drosophila fruit flies. Worked great and had a pest free crop!
customer_reviews.author: Neil R

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for wrapping young apple trees for the winter to ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for wrapping young apple trees for the winter to keep the deer from browsing on them. I use clothespins to help keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: Edge ravels
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars if not for the raveling that occurred immediately on one of the long edges. This causes it to catch on plant material when covering/uncovering the plants making it harder to work with. Perhaps it was defective.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Agibon AG-19 floating row crop cover
customer_reviews.text: Helped a lot in the early stages of the summer. It was also helpful in the early stages of fall when the frosts first hit. Maybe my fault that it didn't do wonderfully, as I made my own holders for the covers, and they were a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gauzy and Fragile
customer_reviews.text: It was much thinner than I'd anticipated. It is rather fragile and pulls apart too easily. One edge was straight as pictured. The opposite edge was frayed, as if it had been pulled apart. It might be ok if doubled. This didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ashfarm

customer_reviews.title: A Gardening Must
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. I am using it to extend the season here in the hills of SW VA. I have it on hoops over my broccoli and kale. Have has several frosts already and it is doing great. Allows water and air to enter which is a plus over another kind that I had. Very sturdy material that resists tearing.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Floyd

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is pretty much useless for me
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is pretty much useless for me .There is one side that is unfinished that started unravelling immediatly upon use, leaving plastic spider webs catching on everything in the greenhouse.Also it is so thin that will not last .Don't reccomend buying this
customer_reviews.author: gilaman

customer_reviews.title: Rip Easily
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy to have these but they do rip easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E.

customer_reviews.title: This fabric is perfect for a wider veggie bed
customer_reviews.text: This fabric is perfect for a wider veggie bed. It's pretty light weight, so perfect for extending the growing season at beginning and end!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I did not use this to keep my plants warm or to ward off pests, but rather as an easy to set up sun shade. My tomatoes and peppers are no longer sun burned and I didn't even need to build a frame. Works like a charm for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Double Strength

customer_reviews.title: doin the job
customer_reviews.text: seems to keep the little flying so n sos out.
customer_reviews.author: 30 sec spot

customer_reviews.title: Durible and flexible
customer_reviews.text: High quality, long lasting! Great for warmth in spring and shade in hot summer.
customer_reviews.author: Jackster

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: The order was exactly what I expected and hoped for. Great for covering my greens to protect from late frosts and flea beetles!
customer_reviews.author: Hob Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would come with binding on edges or something to make it sturdy. The edge is uneven and you can see where it was simply cut off a larger roll. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Agribon AG-19 Floating Row Crop Cover / Frost Blanket / Garden Fabric Plant Cover
product_meta.description: Size:83"X50'Stronger grade to last longer. Provides up to 4º +F frost protection for valuable, frost-sensitive perennials and sensitive vegetables. Agribon floating row covers have all the qualities of other brands, while being more affordable and with seams double-bonded for ultra-strength. These floating rowcovers increase yields, prolong seasons, reduce soil erosion, protect against frost, speed up germination, minimize wind damage, conserve soil moisture, deter insects and birds and protect against extreme temperatures. High quality spun-bonded polypropylene cover is light enough (0.55 oz./sq.yd.) to be laid directly over plants without hoops or frames but strong enough to withstand light to moderate wind and other stress. No need to remove it during the season because it is porous to water and air and has 85% light transmittance. It provides up to 4°F of frost protection, warms the soil and is a good pest barrier. It also conserves water by reducing evaporation. It is similar to other rowcovers but generally longer lasting. UV stabilizers increase expected field life to 2 to 3 seasons.
feature_bullets: ✅ Light weight frost blanket and provides up to 4° F frost protection & 85% Light Transmission
✅ Floating row cover provides frost, wind and organic insect control. Floating row cover traps heat and moisture to produce bigger, better and earlier crop yields.

✅ Agribon is useful for various crops such as melon, tomato, green pepper, hot peppers, watermelon, pumpkin, strawberries and flowers, among others. It is also useful for the protection of tree fruits and berries.
✅ Non-woven garden fabric cover, ultra-light and resistant to exposure to the environment; it allows light, water and air to pass through and is reusable
✅ Agribon helps to increase quality and production while, at the same time, moving forward the harvest date and extending the growing season.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars492 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
